input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week, the weather remained chilly but the sun managed to break through the clouds, warming the air. We took advantage of the mild conditions to go on a day-day hike in the nearby hills. The crisp air and the fresh scent of pine trees invigorated us, and we snapped photos of the stunning views. Work continued to be busy, with several meetings scheduled to discuss project timelines and budgets. I found myself brainstorming ideas for a presentation on sustainable building materials, which I would deliver next month. At home, the kids were eager to start their new school year, and we organized a fun scavenger hunt to help them settle back into the routine. The evening was spent watching a classic movie, and we all enjoyed the cozy atmosphere. The week ended with a visit to the local library, where we checked out books for the kids and picked up a few for ourselves. It was a productive and enjoyable week, filled with outdoor activities and family bonding.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
The week began with a flurry of activity as we prepared for the upcoming sailing school. My wife and I spent hours researching different schools and discussing which one would best suit our needs. We decided to sign up for a week-long course starting in mid-May. In the meantime, we practiced our basic sailing skills in the backyard, using a small inflatable boat. The kids were excited about the prospect of learning to sail, and they helped us set up the boat. At work, the team was working on finalizing the designs for the new energy-efficient building project. I spent a lot of time reviewing blueprints and collaborating with colleagues. The evening was spent discussing the progress of the project and brainstorming ways to make it even more innovative. At home, we had a family game night, playing board games and card games, which provided a nice break from the usual routine. The week concluded with a visit to the local farmer's market, where we bought fresh produce and enjoyed a leisurely lunch. It was a week of preparation, creativity, and family fun.

 Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week, the weather turned colder, and we experienced a bit of a snowstorm. The kids were thrilled to play in the snow, building snowmen and having snowball fights. We even made a snow fort in the backyard, which provided hours of entertainment. At work, the team was focused on completing the final stages of the energy-efficient building project. I spent a lot of time reviewing the latest data and making the project on track. The evening was spent discussing the progress of the project and brainstorming ways to make it even more innovative. At home, we had a family movie night, watching a selection of films that everyone enjoyed. The week ended with a visit to the local ice skating rink, where the kids had a blast gliding across the ice. It was a week of fun, creativity, and family bonding.

Olivia is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 04), my wife (birthday on March 28), my child_1 (birthday on December 09), my father (birthday on June 07), my mother (birthday on May 09), 
2) Exploring the ancient temples of Cambodia in week 15-16.

3) Attend a jazz music appreciation club every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Olivia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Noah is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 08), my wife (birthday on July 09), my child_1 (birthday on November 06), my child_2 (birthday on August 31), my child_3 (birthday on November 17), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 6-7.

3) Join a local running club for weekend marathons every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
As the week progressed, the weather remained chilly but not as biting as the previous week. We took advantage of the mild conditions to go on a day-paced hike in the nearby hills. The crisp air and the stunning views provided a much-needed boost to our spirits. At work, I continued working on the design for the energy-efficient building project, collaborating closely with my team. We had several brainstorming sessions, and the ideas were flowing. The kids adjusted well to the new school routine, and they seemed eager to share their experiences with us. One evening, we had a family game night, which turned out to be a lot of fun. We played trivia, charades, and even tried our hand at a new board game. It was a great way to bond and unwind after a busy week. The week ended with a cozy evening watching a classic movie, and we all agreed that it was a good start to the new year.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
This week saw a slight warming trend, and we decided to take a day trip to the beach for a day day. The sun was shining, and the water was surprisingly warm for early January. We spent the day day lounging on the sand, swimming, and playing beach games. The kids were thrilled, and it was a welcome change from the usual winter activities. Back at the office, the project was moving forward, and we had a meeting with the client to discuss the progress. The feedback was positive, and we felt encouraged to continue pushing forward. At home, we started down the last of the Christmas decorations and started to prepare for the upcoming school events. The kids were excited about the upcoming field play, and we helped them practice their lines and songs. The week concluded with a family dinner where we shared stories of the day day and looked forward to the new opportunities that lay ahead.

 Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
The weather took a turn for the worse, bringing heavy snow and icy conditions. We stayed indoors most of the week, but it didn't dampen our spirits. We spent the day days baking cookies and makingting them together, trying out new recipes. The kids were particularly excited about the baking, and we ended up with a variety of delicious treats. At work, the project continued to progress, and we had another meeting with the client to review out the details. The feedback was constructive, and we made some adjustments to the design. At home, the kids started back to school, and the transition was smooth. They seemed to enjoy their classes and the new friends they made. We also started to plan for the upcoming family vacation, which would be a week-long trip to Bali. The week ended with a family movie night, where we watched a heartwarming film, and we all felt grateful for the simple joys in life.

 Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
The snow finally cleared, and the sun made an appearance, bringing a much-needed break from the cold. We decided to take a day day trip to the mountains for a day day of skiing. The kids were thrilled, and we spent the day day hitting the slopes, enjoying the fresh powder and the crisp mountain air. Back at the office, the project was nearing completion, and we had a final meeting with the client to present the design. The feedback was overwhelmingly positive, and we felt a sense of accomplishment. at home, the kids settled into their new routines, and we started to prepare for the upcoming family vacation. We booked the flights and hotel, and the kids were eagerly looking forward to the adventure. The week ended with a family dinner where we shared stories of the skiing trip and looked forward to the exciting journey ahead.

 Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th):
The weather remained pleasant, and we decided to take a day day trip to the countryside for a picnic. The kids were excited, and we packed a basket with sandwiches, fruits, and snacks. We found a beautiful spot by a lake, and we spent the day day enjoying the scenery, playing games, and having a great time. Back at the office, the project was completed, and we had a celebratory lunch with the team. The client was impressed with the final design, and we felt proud of our hard work. at home, the kids settled into their new routines, and we started to prepare for the upcoming family vacation. We started to pack and make sure everything was in order. The week ended with a family game night, where we played a variety of games, and we all felt content with the progress we had made.

 Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th):
The weather turned colder again, and we decided to stay indoors for most of the week. We spent the days working on various DIY projects, such as painting and refurbishing old furniture. The client was satisfied with the final product, and we felt relieved. at home, the kids settled into their new routines, and we started to prepare for the upcoming family vacation. Noah is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 22), my wife (birthday on September 03), my child_1 (birthday on March 21), my father (birthday on February 16), my mother (birthday on February 04), 
2) Week-long road trip across the Pacific Coast Highway in week 27-28.

3) Join a historical walking tour of the city every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 14.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week, the weather remained chilly but not as frigid as last week. The forecast predicted a gradual warming trend, which brought a sense of optimism. At work, I continued working on the design for the energy-efficient building project, focusing on the thermal insulation aspects. My team and I had a brainstorming session where we explored various materials and techniques that could enhance the building's energy performance. The discussions were lively, and everyone was eager to contribute ideas. At home, the kids were back in the swing of things, adjusting to the routine of school and extracurricular activities. We attended a parent-teacher conference for my child_1, where the teacher praised her progress in math and encouraged us to continue supporting her. The conference also highlighted areas where she could improve, such as reading comprehension. We left feeling reassured and motivated. The weekend was spent exploring local museums and galleries, which provided a cultural break from the usual routine. We visited an exhibition on local history, which was particularly enlightening, especially since it coincided with the start of our historical walking tours, which began in week 14. Overall, the week was a mix of professional growth and personal enrichment.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
The weather started warmer, reaching a high of 10°C, which felt like a welcome change. At work, I presented my design proposal to the team, and there was a lot of positive feedback. The project seemed to be gaining momentum, and I felt a surge of motivation. At home, the kids were busy with their school projects and extracurricular activities. My child_1 was preparing for a science fair, and we spent many evenings helping her research and build her project. My wife and I also took advantage of the nice weather to take a day-long hike in the nearby mountains, enjoying the scenic views and fresh air. The weekend was spent at a local farmer's market, where we bought fresh produce and met some friendly vendors. We also attended a community event celebrating the winter solstice, which included live music and traditional dancing. Overall, the week was filled with progress at work and family time, and the community events added a festive touch to the season.

This week, the weather fluctuated between mild and chilly, with temperatures ranging from 9°C to 13°C. The team was enthusiastic about the potential impact of these innovations. At home, the kids were getting into their school routines, and my child_1 was preparing for a debate competition. We practiced public speaking and argumentation skills together, which was both challenging but rewarding. The weekend was spent at a local art gallery, where we saw an exhibition on contemporary art. The pieces were thought-provoking and diverse, and it sparked many conversations among us. Overall, the week was a balance of professional development and creative exploration, with a touch of family bonding.

1) Specific floors requirements:

  - Designate Floor 99 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 55 for music school use.
  - Designate Floor 7 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 35 for small cinema use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 63 to 67 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 20 floors, starting from Floor 40
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests.

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for real estate agency use.
  - Designate Floor 77 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 71 for language school use.
  - Designate Floor 18 for veterinary clinic use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for retail store use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 3 to 9 for a advanced technology and research institute.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 40 for legal services use.
  - Designate Floor 15 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 94 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 52 for office use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 72 to 77 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a sky garden every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests.

 Floor 2: 
This floor is dedicated to administrative offices, providing a quiet and efficient workspace for staff. Key features include: 1) Open Plan Layout: The office layout is open-plan, promoting collaboration and communication among employees. 2) Natural Light: Large windows along the perimeter allow ample natural light to flood the space, enhancing both productivity and mood. 3) Ergonomic Furniture: Desks and chairs are ergonomically, ensuring comfort and health for long working hours. 

 Floor 3: 
This floor houses the executive boardroom, designed for high-level meetings and presentations. Features include: 1) Conference Room Setup: The room is equipped with state-of-the-art audio-visual technology, including a large screen and high-definition projector. 2) Comfortable Seating: The seating arrangement is semi-circular, allowing all participants to engage easily. 3) Acoustic Treatment: Special acoustic panels are installed to ensure clear sound quality during meetings.

 Floor 4 
This floor is allocated for meeting rooms, catering to various group sizes and purposes. Key features include: 1) Versatile Spaces: Multiple meeting rooms are available, each small for one-on-one discussions to large for team meetings. 2) Audio-Visual Equipment: Each room is equipped with essential AV equipment, such as projectors and whiteboards. 3) Privacy and Comfort: Soundproof walls and comfortable seating ensure a professional yet relaxed atmosphere.

This floor is designated for the company's cafeteria, offering a variety of dining options. Features include: 1) Diverse Menu Options: The cafeteria provides a range of meals, from quick bites to full-course lunches, catering to different dietary preferences. 2) Comfortable Seating Areas: There are several seating areas, including tables and benches, suitable for both casual eating and socializing. 3) Outdoor Space (if applicable) - If weather permitting, diners can enjoy their meals on an outdoor terrace, providing a pleasant change of scenery.

This floor is reserved for the company's training and development center, focusing on employee growth and skill enhancement. input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We We continue our celebration with a focus on fresh seafood and comforting classics. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Crab Cakes Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with herbs and spices, pan-fried to a golden crisp. 
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Marinated artichoke hearts, drizzled with olive oil and balsamic reduction. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seared Scallops Scallops seareded to a perfect golden brown, served with a light lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Beef Bourguignon Slow-cooked beef stew with red wine, onions, and mushrooms, served over creamy polenta. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy, tossed with garlic and thyme. 
   3.2) Truffle Fries Crispy fries tossed with truffle oil and grated parmesan. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Raspberry Sorbet Light and refreshing raspberry sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a hint of lemon, served with a berry coulis. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection of robust red wines to pair with the hearty main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With a twist of lemon or lime for a refreshing alternative.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 02-02 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-11 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.5 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 32 to Week 35 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse Rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
 We continue our journey into the heart of winter with hearty and comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Freshly smoked salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
   1.2) Truffle Frittersa A light, fluffy frittata infused with truffle oil and topped with grated Parmesan. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Beef Wellington A tender fillet of beef wrapped in puff pastry, served with a red wine reduction. 
   2.2) Braised Short Ribs Slow-cooked short ribs with a savory red wine sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted with garlic and thyme. 
   3.2) Creamed Spinach Creamy, velvety spinach with a hint of nutmeg. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Apple Crumble Warm apple crumble with a crunchy oat topping. 
   4.2) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a raspberry coulis. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wines A selection of robust reds to pair with the rich main courses. 
   5.2) Hot Chocolate A decadent hot chocolate with a sprinkle of cinnamon.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
 As we move into the third week, we introduce lighter fare with fresh and vibrant flavors. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Avocado Deviled Eggs Creamy avocado mixed with deviled egg yolk and a touch of lime.

2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seareded Cod with Lemon Butter A delicate cod fillet seareded to perfection, served with a zesty lemon butter sauce. 
   2.2) Grilled Chicken Breast with Chimichuria A succulent chicken breast marinated in chimichuria sauce, grilled to juicy perfection. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Asparagus Asparagus spears roasted with olive oil and sea salt. 
   3.2) Quinoa Salad A refreshing quinoa salad with cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and mint. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Sorbet A light and refreshing lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Raspberry Cheesecake A creamy cheesecake with a tart raspberry filling. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) White Wines A selection of crisp whites to complement the lighter dishes. 
   5.2) Iced Tea Iiced tea with a twist of lemon and a splash of honey.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
 For the fourth week, we explore the world of international flavors with a fusion of cuisines. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Thai Basil Chicken Lettuce Wraps Chicken breast marinated in a spicy Thai basil sauce, wrapped in lettuce leaves. 
   1.2) Moroccan Spiced Lamb Meatballs Spicy lamb meatballs served with a sweet and tangy harissa sauce. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Korean BBQ Beef Short Ribs Korean-style beef short ribs marinated in a sweet soy sauce and grilled to perfection.

3. Side Dishes

4. Desserts

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
   1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
   1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Lobster Thermidor Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
   2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
   3.2) Glazed Carrots Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts 
   4.1) Chocolate Mousse A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
   4.2) Tiramisu Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks 
   5.1) Fine Wines A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
   5.2) Champagne Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We This week, we introduce a light yet satisfying midweek meal with seasonal soup and salad. 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare Freshly chopped smoked salmon mixed with capers, dill, and a touch of lemon juice. 
   1.2) Artichoke Hearts Salad Artichoke hearts tossed with baby arugula, lemon vinaigrette, and toasted pine nuts. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Pan-Seared Chicken Breast Chicken breast seareded to a golden brown, served with a side of roasted asparagus. 
   2.2) Beef Bourguignon Slow-cooked beef braised in red wine, served with a rich, creamy sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables A medley of root vegetables roasted to perfection, seasoned with thyme and rosemary. 
   3.2) Garlic Bread Crusty bread slices brushed with garlic butter and baked until golden. 
4. Soups and Salads 
   4.1) Butternut Squash Soup Creamy butternut squash soup with a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. 
   4.2) Mixed Greens Salad Mixed greens dressed with a light vinaigrette and topped with sliced apples and walnuts. 
5. Desserts 
   4.1) Lemon Sorbet Refreshing lemon sorbet to cleanse the palate. 
   4.2) Raspberry Tart Tart filled with fresh raspberries and a crumbly shortcrust crust. 
6. Drinks 
   5.1) White Wine Selection of crisp white wines to pair with the lighter dishes. 
   5.2) Sparkling Water With a twist of lemon or lime for a refreshing option.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Crab Cakes Jumbo lump crab meat mixed with herbs and spices, pancted into a pourdouf base. 
   1.2) Grilled Octopus Tentacles marinated in olive oil, lemon, and garlic, grilled to perfection. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb Lamb chops coated in a herbed crust, roasted to medium-rare. 
   2.2) Pan-Seareded Sea Bass Sea bass fillets seareded to a golden brown, served with a lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts Brussels sprouts roasted until crispy, seasoned with balsamic vinegar and honey. 
   3.2) Wild Rice Pilaf A flavorful pilaf made with wild rice, carrots, and onions. 
4. Soups and Salads 
   4.1) Tomato Basil Soup Rich tomato basil soup with a hint of cream. 
   4.2) Arugula Salad Arugula tossed with cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and a tangy lemon dressing. 
5. Desserts 
   4.1) Panna Cotta Vanilla panna cotta with a drizzle of caramel sauce. 
   4.2) Chocolate Truffle Cake Dark chocolate cake with a smooth truffle filling. 
6. Drinks 
   5.1) Red Wine Selection of full-bodied red wines to complement the hearty main courses. 
   5.2) Sparkling Rosé For a lighter touch, a sparkling rosé is offered.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
1. Appetizers 
   1.1) Shrimp Cocktail Fresh shrimp served in a zesty cocktail sauce, garnished with celery sticks. 
   1.2) Goat Cheese Crostini Toasted baguette slices topped with goat cheese, honey, and chives. 
2. Main Courses 
   2.1) Grilled Ribeye Steak Ribeye steak grilled to your desired doneness, served with a side of sautéed spinach. 
   2.2) Pan-Seareded Cod Cod fillets seareded to a golden brown, served with a lemon dill sauce. 
3. Side Dishes 
   3.1) Roasted Cauliflower Cauliflower roasted until tender, seasoned with thyme and parmesan.

6. Drinks

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.52: Christmas Gala Dinner featuring Roasted Goose
checks_once.11: Saint Patrick's Day featuring Irish Stew
checks_once.45: random of Year Party featuring Gourmet Cheese Platter
checks_once.24: Father's Day Feast featuring Barbecued Ribs
checks_once.35: Summer Solstice Celebration featuring Midsummer Night's Fish Fry

checks_range.5: Squash and Pumpkin Delights featuring Pumpkin Pie

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Memorial Day BBQ' on 09-03 with a special dish: Smoked Brisket.
1.3 Celebrate 'Mother's Day Meal' on 05-13 with a special dish: Eggs Benedict with Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Bastille Day Party' on 07-14 with a special dish: Coq au Vin.
1.5 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 03-21 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Pasta Wednesdays' every 5 weeks starting from Week 18, serving: Spaghetti Carbonara.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)

1. Appetizers:

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (3, 0) for botanical garden use.
  - Designate Block at (7, 5) for library use.

  - Designate Block at (1, 6) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (4, 7) for botanical garden use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the row from (7, 2) to (7, 5).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each block like (e.g. #*# Block 1 (0, 0): 
This block is the entry point to the cultural quarter and is dedicated to a contemporary art gallery. The details are as follows: Architecture: The building is designed with expansive glass facades and a minimalist aesthetic, making it a landmark in the cityscape. Its structure allows for maximum natural light, which highlights the artworks inside and creates an inviting atmosphere for visitors. The gallery also offers educational programs and workshops, fostering community engagement and supporting local artists.)
